intro: Harmogia crenulata, commonly known as the crested spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing a high degree of drought tolerance. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a lobed or serrated edge, contributing to its unique appearance. Harmogia crenulata is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in poor nutrient conditions.
